Crisis Communications Joint Crisis Communications Plan
Crisis Communications
Joint Crisis Communications Plan
page.normal_text:
In a large-scale crisis, the message communicated to parents requires inter-agency coordination. Due to the complexity of the event, multiple agencies will be involved in crafting the message.

communicated to parents requires inter-agency

message.

page.title:
Joint Information Center (JIC) During a School Emergency/Crisis
Joint Information Center (JIC)
During a School Emergency/Crisis
page.normal_text:
handle all release of information to the media.
handle all release of information to the media.
page.enlisting:
• JIC responsibilities will include: staffing of center,
• JIC responsibilities will include: staffing of center, identifying a media holding center, identifying appropriate spokespersons, setting up media briefing schedules, writing/approving news releases, and approving message points, release of video footage, and other related material.
identifying a media holding center, identifying appropriate
spokespersons, setting up media briefing schedules,
writing/approving news releases, and approving
message points, release of video footage, and other
related material.

picture.caption: • The lead PIO will be from the lead agency, responding to the emergency, or a designee of that agency's choosing. • The JIC, under the supervision of incident command, will

P a r e n t s
page.normal_text:
Why did we target parents/guardians?
Why did we target parents/guardians?

Application process for the Emergency Response and Crisis Management grant revealed a gap and inconsistencies in the notification process for parents/guardians during a large-scale school emergency.
Application process for the Emergency
Response and Crisis Management grant
revealed a gap and inconsistencies in the r e v e a l e d
a
g a p a n d
i n c o n s i s t e n c i e s i n
t h e
notification process for parents/guardians n o t i f i c a t i o n
p r o c e s s f o r
p a r e n t s / g u a r d i a n s
during a large-scale school emergency.

In other words, we did not have a division-wide plan!
In other words, we did not have a division-wide plan!

page.title:
What is our message for parents?
What is our message for parents?
page.enlisting:
1. To assure parents that the school division is prepared to 2. To advise parents how they can be prepared for a school 3. To inform parents how they can get important information 4. To educate parents about key terms that will be used during 5. To provide parents with guidelines on what will be needed to pick up their child in the school or at an alternate location should the school be evacuated. 1.
